results.name: Run lengths in the binary expansion of n gives the vector of exponents in prime factorization of a(n)+1, with the least significant run corresponding to the exponent of the least prime, 2; with one subtracted from each run length, except for the most significant run of 1's.
comment: To make this a permutation of nonnegative integers, we subtract one from each run count except for the most significant run, e.g. a(11) = 9, as 11 = 1011 and 9+1 = 10 = 5^1 * 3^(1-1) * 2^(2-1).
link: Paul Tek (terms 0..10000) & Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..16384
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
